item.title: TYPO3 Extensions and Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP)
item.dc:creator: FiveE Technologies
item.description: Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) is a technology to have pages load quickly on mobile devices. AMP is backed by industry heavy weights like Google, Twitter, WordPress, several publishers and other companies. The challenge in short is that it has own HTML and JavaScript library. So can we use TYPO3 extension while building an website in […]
item.content:encoded:
Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) is a technology to have pages load quickly on mobile devices. AMP is backed by industry heavy weights like Google, Twitter, WordPress, several publishers and other companies. The challenge in short is that it has own HTML and JavaScript library.

So can we use TYPO3 extension while building an website in AMP?

The answer is : Yes we can use most of the TYPO3 extensions but we not all extension. There are exceptions. Some TYPO3 extensions are are completely non-usable and some can be used after some alter in just templates and others might need extensive change in code level.

Why we can not use some TYPO3 extensions in websites built on AMP technology?

  • Google AMP has own HTML
  • You can not use your JS Libraries
  • Many tags like <img src > will not work

 

50% of browsing now happens on mobile devices. Don’t be left out. Get priority on Search engines. Get AMP on your site now.

Contact at info@t3in.com for AMP on your site.

item.title: How to set the OG and DCTERMS meta tags in TYPO3
item.dc:creator: Vikram Mandal
item.description: In case you are using the TYPO3 extension: bootstrap_package then set: page.meta.og:title.field = subtitle // title This would set the < meta property=”og:title” … > value to the page field value of subtitle is available else it would use the page title field value. By default it is set to use the title column only. You can use the susbtitle […]
item.content:encoded:
In case you are using the TYPO3 extension: bootstrap_package then set:

page.meta.og:title.field = subtitle // title

This would set the < meta property=”og:title” … > value to the page field value of subtitle is available else it would use the page title field value. By default it is set to use the title column only. You can use the susbtitle column to set better SEO optimized page title in TYPO3.

 

In case you are using the TYPO3 extension: metaseo then set:

plugin.metaseo.metaTags.opengraph.title.field = tx_metaseo_pagetitle // title
plugin.metaseo.metaTags.conf.title_page.field = tx_metaseo_pagetitle // title

This would set the DCTERMS.title and OG:title meta tags in TYPO3

Contact us for full search engine optimization and social media optimization of your TYPO3 website.

item.title: Post tx_News to Facebook Social Media
item.dc:creator: FiveE Technologies
item.description: The newest news extension on Typo3 is the “News” extension. This extension also referred as tx_news some times is build in the latest Typo3 Extbase and fluid development platform. The older news extension was “tt_news”. The latest news extension did not ad the functionality to post news items on social media. So we have developed […]
item.content:encoded:
The newest news extension on Typo3 is the “News” extension. This extension also referred as tx_news some times is build in the latest Typo3 Extbase and fluid development platform. The older news extension was “tt_news”.

The latest news extension did not ad the functionality to post news items on social media. So we have developed a Typo3 module to post post news items to social media and email them as well to subscribers. News items can be posted to Facebook pages directly from Typo3 backend administration section. The module also allows to post direct content with url to social media.

The new extension is fully compatible with search engine optioned Urls of news any other Typo3 Seo features or extensions like realurl.
